isotib 0.1.2

Create a grob of isocubes

Source: R/isocubes.R
isocubesGrob.Rd

Create a grob of isocubes

Usage

isocubesGrob(
  coords,
  fill = "grey90",
  fill2 = NULL,
  fill3 = NULL,
  light = "top-left",
  ysize = 1/20,
  xo = 0.5,
  yo = ysize,
  verbose = FALSE,
  ...
)

Arguments

coords

data.frame of x,y,z coordinates for the cubes (integer coordinates)

fill

fill colour for the main face of cube as specified by the light argument. By default, this will be the colour of the top face of the cube, as the default light = 'top-left'.

fill2, fill3

fill colours for secondary and tertiary faces of cube - as specified in the light argument. If set to NULL (the default) then cube faces will be darkened versions of the main fill color.

light

direction of light. This is a two-word argument nominating the main light direction and secondary light direction. The default value of 'top-left' indicates the light is brightest from the top, and then from the left side of the cube - with the right side of the cube being darkest. This argument is only used if fill2 and fill3 are unspecified. Possible values are: top-left, top-right, left-top, left-right, right-top, right-left.

ysize

the size of a cube as a fraction of the window height. Default: 0.05, which means that, at most, 20 cubes could stack from top to bottom and be visible.

xo, yo

the origin of the isometric coordinate system in 'snpc' coordinates. These values should be given as vanilla floating point values. Be default the origin is the middle bottom of the graphics device i.e. (xo, yo) = (0.5, 0)

verbose

Be verbose? Default FALSE.

...

other values passed to gpar() to set the graphical parameters e.g. lwd and col for the linewidth and colour of the outline stroke for each cube face.
